#â€‹520 â€” August 27, 2024

UnsubÂ Â |Â Â WebÂ Version

Go Weekly

Range Over Function Types in Go 1.23 â€” Go 1.23 was released just two weeks ago with one of the headline features being improvements to iteration, principally for/range support over function types. Thereâ€™s a lot more to it than that, though, and Ian rounds up everything, complete with examples andÂ guidance.

Ian Lance Taylor

TinyGo 0.33.0: The Go Compiler for 'Small Places' â€” TinyGo is a fantastic LLVM-based Go implementation targeting use cases like microcontrollers and WebAssembly. v0.33.0 brings it up to Go 1.23 standards, adds WASI preview 2 support, andÂ more.

TinyGo Team

WorkOS: The Modern Identity Platform for B2BÂ SaaS â€” WorkOS is a modern identity platform for B2B SaaS, offering flexible and easy-to-use APIs to integrate SSO, SCIM, and RBAC in minutes instead of months. It's trusted by hundreds of high-growth startups such as Perplexity, Vercel, Drata, andÂ Webflow.

WorkOS sponsor

The 4-chan Go Programmer (or Sending Channels OverÂ Channels) â€” No, not that '4chan.' Zach looks into the idea of using channels to pass other channels around, and takes it to the extreme of creating channels that channel channels that channel channels that channel channels. I need to go for a lieÂ down..

Zach Musgrave

sync.Pool and the Mechanics Behind It â€” What sync.Pool is all about, how itâ€™s used, whatâ€™s going on under the hood, and everything else you might want to know, complete with helpfulÂ illustrations.

Phuong Le

ğŸ“„ Designing a Robust Integration Test Suite for Convoyâ€™s Data Plane with TestContainers Oluwalana and Mekiliuwa (Convoy)

ğŸ“„ 'Go is My Hammer, and Everything is a Nail' â€“ You can use Go forÂ everything. Markus WÃ¼stenberg

ğŸ“„ How Go's Testing Harness Works â€“ What happens when you run goÂ test? Matt Proud

ğŸ“„ Using Functional Options Instead of Method Chaining Jon Calhoun

sqlite-vec: A Vector Search Extension for SQLite â€” If using a dedicated vector storage database is beyond your immediate requirements, you can now use SQLite for the task. While this is an SQLite extension, itâ€™s easy to use with numerous languages, including Go, as shownÂ here.

Alex Garcia

moq: An Interface Mocking Tool for go generate â€” A tool that generates a struct from any interface. The struct can be used in test code as a mock of the interface. Now supports imported typeÂ aliases.

Mat Ryer

Streamline Your Product Delivery with monday dev â€” From ideation to launch, monday dev makes product delivery faster and simpler, all in oneÂ place.

monday dev sponsor

Permify 1.0: Open Source Authorization as a Service â€” A long standing Go-powered system for building fine-grained authorization systems, inspired by Googleâ€™s Zanzibar. Get started with the introÂ guide.

Permify

cast 1.7: Safe and Easy Casting from One Type to Another â€” Itâ€™s as easy as using ToString, ToInt, ToTime, andÂ more.

Steve Francia

go-github v64.0: A Go Client for the GitHub v3 API â€” For the REST API. For the v4 GraphQL API use thisÂ instead.

Google

Dbmate: A Lightweight, Framework-Agnostic Database Migration Tool â€” Written in Go but can be used alongside database-using apps written in any language. Supports MySQL, Postgres, SQLite, ClickHouse, BigQuery, andÂ Spanner.

Adrian Macneil

ğŸ“°Â Classifieds

Dragonfly (25k GitHub stars) is a modern Redis replacement. Organizations that switch to Dragonfly can reduce infrastructure costs by 80%.

Boost your PostgreSQL skills with Redgateâ€™s 101 webinar series of easy-to-follow, expert hosted sessions. Itâ€™s PostgreSQL, simplified.

  • go-rest-api-example â€“ Template for an enterprise-ready REST APIÂ microservice.

  • Glow 2.0 â€“ Markdown renderer for theÂ terminal.

  • Dynamo 2.2 â€“ Expressive Amazon DynamoDB clientÂ library.

  • ğŸ’„ Charm Lip Gloss 0.13 â€“ Style definitions for rendering nice terminalÂ layouts. It can now renderÂ treesÂ too!

  • GoWrap 1.4 â€“ Tool to generate decorators for GoÂ interfaces.

  • Buf 1.38 â€“ CLI tool for working with ProtocolÂ Buffers.

  • c-for-go 1.3 â€“ Automatic C-Go bindings generator.

  • Go OpenAI 1.29 â€“ An OpenAI API wrapperÂ library.

  • Bubbles 0.19 â€“ TUI components for BubbleÂ Tea.

  • netlink 1.3 â€“ Simple Netlink library for Go.

ğŸ And one for fun..

Tetrigo: TUI-Powered Tetris Written in Go â€” Whether you want to just play Tetris, create your own Tetris game, or perhaps implement your own quirky Tetris game mode using Go, this implementation is for you. Itâ€™s well structured and uses Charmâ€™s Bubble Tea behind theÂ scenes.

Broderick Westrope

item.title: ã€Why Go's telemetry is worth enablingã€‘ä¸ºä»€ä¹ˆ Go çš„é¥æµ‹å€¼å¾—å¯ç”¨
item.description:
ã€

#â€‹522 â€” September 10, 2024

UnsubÂ Â |Â Â WebÂ Version

Go Weekly

Share Your Feedback in the Latest Go Developer Survey â€” Itâ€™s your latest chance to influence the direction of Go! The core team really pays attention to the results and is looking for insights into the challenges you have and improvements you want. Certainly worth a few minutes of yourÂ time.

Alice Merrick and the Go Team

Telemetry in Go 1.23 and Beyond â€” In early 2023, Russ Cox introduced the idea of â€˜transparent telemetryâ€™ for Go. Some folks responded poorly to the idea of it being on by default so it became opt-in and was included in Go 1.23. Here, Robert explains how useful such telemetry can be, if youâ€™re tempted to enableÂ it.

Robert Findley

The Frontend Masters Knowledge Quest Sale Is Going on All Week! â€” The Frontend Masters Knowledge Quest sale is now on! There's four new learning paths (including JS performance and code architecture) with more epic courses on the way throughout 2024 andÂ beyond.

Frontend Masters sponsor

IN BRIEF:

  • Go 1.23.1 and 1.22.7 were released, including three security fixes.

  • Julia Evans explains why she loves Go, noting that she'd "rather have a very simple tool that's less powerful in some ways but that I know will work."

How Go Tests go test (And You Can Too!) â€” Testing is all well and good, but who tests the tester? Itâ€™s actually quite the tale, and Rotem demonstrates how you can adopt the same approach for your own CLIÂ tools.

Rotem Tamir (Atlas)

ğŸ› ï¸Â How to Check for Price Drops with Functions, Cron and LLMs â€” A fun, practical example of using an open source (and Go powered!) functions as a service platform along with a Go function to get a bargain on someÂ chisels..

Alex Ellis (OpenFaaS)

Statically and Dynamically Linked Go Binaries â€” A quick look at Goâ€™s linking mechanisms, contrasting the differences in approach between static and dynamic dependencies and internal vs externalÂ linkers.

Alex Pliutau

Don't defer Close() on Writable Files â€” This post dates from 2017 and there are ways to improve this now, but it provoked an interesting discussion on Hacker News today.

Joe Shaw

Streamline Your Product Delivery with monday dev â€” From ideation to launch, monday dev makes product delivery faster and simpler, all in oneÂ place.

monday dev sponsor

ğŸ“„ Building a Zero Trust SSH Client in Go â€“ How to build a simplistic SSH client using Goâ€™s standard library, and shifting it to usingÂ OpenZiti. Clint Dovholuk

ğŸ“„ A Tale of Transpiling Go and Java to Ruby using LLMs â€“ An interesting look at a successful attempt using GPT-4o and Claude. Symflower

ğŸ’Œ A Love Letter to Go Tom Jowitt

ğŸ›  Code & Tools

live-pprof: Monitor Go App Performance Live in Dev â€” This is very new, so your mileage may vary, but it's a neat idea. Rather than profiling an app and looking at the results after, why not look at things while you Go.. (without installing the usual heavy instrumentationÂ tools).

Clement 2026

Ergo 3.0: An Actor-Based Framework for Go â€” A Go-based implementation of ideas and design patterns from the ErlangÂ world.

Taras Halturin

Sprig: 100+ Useful Template Functions for Go Templates â€” If you use text/template you might find this selection of template functions useful.

Masterminds

Garble: A Toolchain to Obfuscate Go Builds â€” Obfuscation doesnâ€™t guarantee security but if you want your binaries to have â€œas little information about the original source code as possible,â€ Garble presents an option for GoÂ 1.22+.

Daniel MartÃ­

ğŸ“°Â Classifieds

Dragonfly (25k GitHub stars) is a modern Redis replacement. Organizations that switch to Dragonfly can see 25X performanceÂ improvements.

go-astiav: ffmpeg and libav Bindings for Go â€” The goal is to provide a more idiomatically Go API for FFmpegâ€™s various multimedia handling features. Works with FFmpeg 7Â only.

Quentin Renard

Enmime 1.3: MIME Encoding and Decoding Package â€” Focused on generating and parsing MIME encodedÂ emails.

James Hillyerd

  • VHS 0.8 â€“ CLI 'home video recorder'. "Write terminal GIFs as code for integration testing and demoing your CLIÂ tools."

  • Goose 3.22 â€“ Database migration tool. Supports SQL and GoÂ functions.

  • Wish 1.4.3 â€“ Charm's tooling to make Go-powered SSHÂ apps.

  • pgxmock 4.3 â€“ Mock driver to test database interactions inÂ Go.

  • Ebiten 2.7.9 â€“ Go's simple 2D gameÂ engine.

ğŸ And one for fun..

A Small Mandelbrot Set Renderer in Go â€” A neat and tidy example of creating a simple fractal rendering engine in Go that can also be adapted to run on the Web via WebAssembly. GitHubÂ repo.

Go Weekly

Go 1.23's New unique Package â€” The packageâ€™s purpose is to make comparing values more efficient by using deduplication to point to unique, canonical copies, a concept called interning. Some knowledge is required, but Michael walks through everything you need to know, including a practicalÂ example.

Michael Knyszek (Go Team)

Tips for Building Bubble Tea Programs â€” Bubble Tea is a powerful Go framework for building terminal user interfaces (TUIs). Louis has spent a lot of time building PUG (a Terraform TUI) and shares the fruits of his experienceÂ here.

Louis Garman

ğŸ¥³ And, happily, Bubble Tea just celebrated reaching version 1.0! And was then quickly followed with v1.1 which adds focus and blur windowÂ events.

Go Beyond Limits with Golang, Rust, Docker &Â K8â€™s â€” Struggling with tech challenges? Ardan Labs offers unparalleled consulting in Go, Rust, Docker, and Kubernetes. Enhance your development speed, optimize your architecture, and manage tech debt. Propel your team to new heights with ourÂ expertise!

Ardan Labs Consulting sponsor

Slices in Go: Grow Big or Go Home â€” A deep dive into slices that focuses on how slices grow, something that can bite you right in the code when you donâ€™t understand it. For example, do you know when (and why) a slice ends up on the heap (orÂ not)?

Phuong Le (VictoriaMetrics)

IN BRIEF:

  • There's an active proposal to introduce a package that brings weakÂ pointers/references toÂ Go.

  • Go-HTMX, an approach building frontend UI components in Go, rather than JavaScript, has just reached version 1.0.

  • Matt Boyle has opened up a waitlist for Chris Shepherd's forthcoming Building Production-Ready Services with gRPC and Go course.

  • ğŸ‡°ğŸ‡· GopherCon Korea 2024 is taking place this year in Hanam (near Seoul) onÂ OctoberÂ 12-13.

Dumb Ways to Die: Random Values in Pointers â€” Storing non-pointer values in unsafe.Pointer is.. a Bad Ideaâ„¢, but why? What happens? The journey and answer could help you better understand pointers and unsafe.

Phil Pearl

Mastering ISO 8583 Message Networking with Go â€” ISO 8583 is an interchange standard for card-based financial transactions (such as from a point-of-sale terminal orÂ ATM).

Pavel Gabriel

ğŸ“„ Building Terminal Applications in Go â€“ With Bubble Tea, Cobra, andÂ Viper. Harrison Cramer

ğŸ“„ Building Go Stack Traces from BPF â€“ Based on work being done by Grant to improve Datadogâ€™s GoÂ instrumentation. Grant Seltzer

Tunalog: A No-Install Blogging System Built in Go â€” With Markdown, theming support, and Web-based editing, Tunalog provides all a simple blog framework needs. Itâ€™s been two years in the making, but its creator is finally happy with it, and judging by the screenshots itâ€™s pretty slick. Itâ€™s cross-platform and usesÂ SQLite.

Yami Odymel

wp2hugo: A WordPress to Hugo Blog Migrator â€” Hugo is a popular Go-powered static site generator and this tool makes it easy to convert WordPress-powered blogs over to it, including lots of edge cases WordPressâ€™s REST API doesnâ€™t helpÂ with.

Ashish Bhatia

Kafka-Compatible Data Streaming That Reduces Costs and Ops Burden â€” Zero ops auto-scaling. Perfect provisioning. 10x cheaper than Kafka. Try WarpStream for free and get $400 inÂ credits.

WarpStream sponsor

GoForge: A CLI Tool to Streamline Go Project Initialization â€” Rather than manually creating files and directories to set up a projectâ€™s structure, GoForge provides a one-lineÂ alternative.

Moutaz Chaara

BadgerDB 4.3: A Fast, Embeddable Key-Balue DB in Go â€” Designed as a performant alternative to non-Go-based key-value stores like RocksDB. Docs.

Dgraph

hyrumtoken: A Package to Encrypt Pagination Tokens â€” For when you donâ€™t want API clients to access unintended 'features' of your pagination related parameters, say.

SSOReady

#â€‹523 â€” September 17, 2024

UnsubÂ Â |Â Â WebÂ Version

Go Weekly

Building LLM-Powered Applications in Go â€” The post describes some different approaches to creating a Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) server with different toolsets: Gemini + Weaviate, LangChain, and Genkit. Goâ€™s natural strengths seem to play well in the modern LLM/RAGÂ arena.

Eli Bendersky

WorkOS: The Modern Identity Platform for B2BÂ SaaS â€” WorkOS is a modern identity platform for B2B SaaS, offering flexible and easy-to-use APIs to integrate SSO, SCIM, and RBAC in minutes instead of months. It's trusted by hundreds of high-growth startups such as Perplexity, Vercel, Drata, andÂ Webflow.

WorkOS sponsor

Notes on Running Go in the Browser with WebAssembly â€” Eli explains the basics of calling Go from JavaScript, manipulating the DOM, using TinyGo to reduce the size of the resulting WASM binary, and running things concurrently using WebÂ Workers.

Eli Bendersky

IN BRIEF:

  • There's less than a week to fill out the latest Go community survey.

  • The RedMonk developer analyst firm has put out a Q3 2024 ranking of programming languages with Go at 12thÂ place. Ahead of Rust, atÂ least!

  • TamaGo is a framework for running Go apps on bare metal ARM/RISC-VÂ SoCs.

  • The Go Time podcast's latest episode â–¶ï¸ digs into home automationÂ withÂ Go.

  • A look at changes to channel-based timers in Go 1.23.

Using Go Instead of Bash for Scripts â€” Using Go to replace your scripts means only having to write the script once for all your platforms and not having to relearn OS-specific scripting languages. Itâ€™s more code, but that could be a small price toÂ pay.

Krzysztof Kowalczyk

Cryptography in Go: AES Encryption â€” The last of a three-part excerpt from Johnâ€™s book on Go and cryptography. Youâ€™re challenged with a couple of enciphering/deciphering problems using AES in Go, complete with Johnâ€™s answers andÂ explanations.

John Arundel

Don't Pretty Print Your API's JSON Response Body â€” In other words, avoid spending time and resources doing something users can do on theirÂ own.

Jamie Tanna

ğŸ“°Â Classifieds

ğŸš€ The first GoLand 2024.3 EAP build is out! Boost your productivity for free with the newest IDE features and improvedÂ performance.

Dragonfly (25k GitHub stars) is a modern Redis replacement. Organizations that switch to Dragonfly can see 25X performanceÂ improvements.

ğŸ“„ How to Implement Server-Sent Events in Go â€“ Server-Sent Events (SSE) is a Web technology for pushing updates from a server to a client withoutÂ WebSockets. Alex Pliutau

ğŸ“„ Transparent Proxy Implementation using eBPF and Go Teodor J. Podobnik

ğŸ“„ Dockerizing a Go API with MySQL and Docker Compose Support Pradumna Saraf

ğŸ“„ A GitHub Trick to Find the Commit That Deleted a File Raymond Chen

ğŸ›  Code & Tools

The TinyGo Playground (Now With More Resources) â€” TinyGoâ€™s playground lets you write code with simulated hardware (like LEDs, etc.) in your browser and now has double the CPU and RAM for your testingÂ pleasure. It can now also show power consumption estimates for yourÂ code.

TinyGo Project

Script 0.23: Make It Easier to Write Shell-like Scripts in Go â€” Makes tasks like reading files, counting lines, making simple HTTP requests, and running subprocesses easier with an array of fluent chainable functions to make using Go in a scripting context a happierÂ experience.

John Arundel

Streamline Your Product Delivery with monday dev â€” From ideation to launch, monday dev makes product delivery faster and simpler, all in oneÂ place.

monday dev sponsor

Maelstrom: A Fast, Contained Test Runner for Multiple Languages â€” Currently supporting Go, Rust, and Python, this suite of tools runs tests in isolated micro-containers and claims to â€˜just workâ€™ with your existing tests. Those tests can then run on your local machine or across an entire cluster. GitHubÂ repo.

Maelstrom

PG Back Web 0.3: A Postgres Backup System with Web Interface â€” A Go-powered app for bringing a bit more of a friendly user interface to Postgres backups, as well as scheduled backups, backup monitoring, andÂ webhooks.

Luis Eduardo

FAIR: A Go Library for Serving Resources 'Fairly' â€” Designed to ensure fairness in resource-constrained environments by distributing said resources evenly across multipleÂ clients.

Mihir Sathe
